speaker: Tower Base
lines: The towerâ€™s stones lean in to hear secrets told at the door.
Steps spiral up in a language your knees can read.
A rope dangles from a bell above; it twitches when you think of lying.
A plaque names the architect and thanks no kings.
A draft smells of paper, pollen, and lightning.
A fallen spear rests against the wall; someone carried it to the top and back.
The door opens if you say nothing for the right amount of time.
Your silence is almost perfect. The door decides to be kind.
